summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 discussing the collection of documents and emails related to the Epstein investigation. The correspondence involves federal prosecutors and an FBI agent, debating the scope of document collection, specifically regarding emails between an FBI agent and an AUSA, and the agent's communications with victims or witnesses.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of emails from an FBI agent regarding the Epstein case. The prosecutors discuss whether to collect these emails.

connections.description: The FBI agent (SA) had email correspondence with the AUSA regarding the Epstein case, indicating they worked together on the investigation.

events.title: Discussion with FBI Agent
events.description: Prosecutors spoke with an FBI agent from the original Florida Epstein investigation about emails and documents in his possession.

keyFacts: An FBI agent from the original Florida Epstein investigation possessed emails with an AUSA and communications with victims or witnesses.
Prosecutors debated the necessity of collecting these specific emails, as they believed existing document collections from OPR should already encompass relevant FBI correspondence.
The agent agreed to send any emails he received from victims or witnesses to the prosecutors.
